headline: Exclusive-ADM cuts jobs in grain trading division, sources say
summary: U.S. grains merchant Archer-Daniels-Midland is making a fresh wave of job cuts this week at its largest unit, the grain trading and oilseed processing division, according to three sources briefed on the matter.  ADM tapped Patolawala for the job last July as it dealt with multiple U.S. investigations, including a criminal one, related to accounting irregularities.

raw.headline: Exclusive-ADM cuts jobs in grain trading division, sources say
raw.summary: U.S. grains merchant Archer-Daniels-Midland is making a fresh wave of job cuts this week at its largest unit, the grain trading and oilseed processing division, according to three sources briefed on the matter.  ADM tapped Patolawala for the job last July as it dealt with multiple U.S. investigations, including a criminal one, related to accounting irregularities.

headline: ADM CEO's 2024 compensation dips amid accounting issues, job cuts
summary: CHICAGO (Reuters) -Archer-Daniels-Midland Co CEO Juan Luciano earned $21.6 million in 2024, down from $24.4 million the prior year, a securities filing on Tuesday showed, as the U.S. grains trader faced accounting problems and cost pressures that triggered layoffs and sent its shares plummeting.  The Chicago-based company was forced to revise six years of financial statements early last year and further restate some earnings later in the year after an internal investigation into its financial reports.  The accounting woes also cost former Chief Financial Officer Vikram Luthar his job and triggered two federal investigations.Luciano's 2024 compensation included a slight increase in base salary to $1.493 million and company stock awards valued at $17.7 million, according to ADM's annual proxy statement filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
